newsitem.title: GERMANY: SAA Cargo to buy own cargo space from today.
newsitem.headline: SAA Cargo to buy own cargo space from today.

text.p: SAA Cargo, the airfreight arm of South African Airways (SAA.CN), said it will take a first step towards independent operations from today.
Wolfgang Els, the airline's Frankfurt-based Europe cargo manager, said the division would take over the full costs of cargo space on the airline's entire fleet from that date.
SAA Cargo had been buying space on SAA passenger flights since January under a test, he said in a Reuters interview.
"From April 1, it will be part of our costs budget. We have bought the whole capacity for an entire year," he said.
He did not name the price paid by SAA Cargo to the passenger division for the belly space.
The internal space purchasing could be a first step towards a more independent structure for SAA Cargo within South African Airways, Els pointed out.
"If we have two divisions - passenger and cargo, then we must be able to see the costs," he added.
